I am not sure if you are more interested in NEAT or HyperNEAT, but for
what=
 it's worth my original NEAT C++ code does come with a tutorial pdf:

http:=
//nn.cs.utexas.edu/soft-view.php?SoftID=3D4

However, the tutorial is more =
about how to use the package than about
the source code itself, although it=
 does point to some specific
routines to explain them.  I also commented ex=
tensively in both that
release and the newer rtNEAT release:

http://nn.cs.=
utexas.edu/soft-view.php?SoftID=3D88

The rtNEAT release includes some expl=
anation of how to interface it
into a real-time game.

Jason also replied a=
bout his HyperNEAT release.

ken
